value.excerpt: Learn how to incorporate security into your architecture design, and discover the tools that Azure provides to help you create a secure environment through all the layers of your architecture.

images.title: Microsoft Azure Well-Architected Framework - Security

value.title: Choose the best Azure service to automate your business processes
value.excerpt: Microsoft Azure provides several different ways to host and execute code or workflows without using Virtual Machines (VMs) including Azure Functions, Microsoft Power Automate, Azure Logic Apps, and Azure WebJobs. In this module, you will learn about these technologies and how to choose the right one for a given scenario.

images.title: Choose the best Azure service to automate your business processes

value.title: Get started with artificial intelligence on Azure
value.excerpt: Artificial Intelligence (AI) empowers amazing new solutions and experiences; and Microsoft Azure provides easy to use services to help you get started.

topItems.title: Get started with AI on Azure
topItems.excerpt: With AI, we can build solutions that seemed like science fiction a short time ago; enabling incredible advances in health care, financial management, environmental protection, and other areas to make a better world for everyone.

images.title: Get started with AI on Azure

value.excerpt: In this learning path, find out how Azure DevOps enables transparency and cooperation with continuous delivery and deployment for your development lifecycle.

topItems.excerpt: Explore what DevOps is (and isn't) and learn how to get started with Azure DevOps.

topItems.excerpt: Learn to optimize delivery efficiency by improving work plan visibility across teams.

value.title: Evolve your DevOps practices
value.excerpt: DevOps is the union of people, process, and products to enable continuous delivery of value to your end users. Azure DevOps is a set of services that gives you the tools you need to do just that. With Azure DevOps, you can build, test, and deploy any application, either to the cloud or on premises. DevOps practices that enable transparency, cooperation, continuous delivery and continuous deployment become embedded in your software development lifecycle.

topItems.title: Assess your existing software development process
topItems.excerpt: Use a value stream map to help you examine your existing processes and technologies.

images.title: Assess your existing software development process

value.title: Administer containers in Azure learning path
value.excerpt: With this learning path, you'll create and manage your Azure Container Instances, and see how they can be used to provide elastic scale for Kubernetes.

topItems.title: Introduction to Docker containers
topItems.excerpt: Describes the benefits of using Docker containers as a containerization platform. Discuss the infrastructure provided by the Docker platform.

images.title: Introduction to Docker containers

topItems.title: Build a containerized web application with Docker
topItems.excerpt: Package a web app so that it can be deployed as a Docker image and run from an Azure Container Instance.

images.title: Build a containerized web application with Docker

topItems.title: Build and store container images with Azure Container Registry
topItems.excerpt: Azure Container Registry is a managed Docker registry service based on the open-source Docker Registry 2.0. Container Registry is private, hosted in Azure, and allows you to build, store, and manage images for all types of container deployments. Learn how to build and store container images with Azure Container Registry.

images.title: Build and store container images with Azure Container Registry

topItems.excerpt: Learn how to run containerized apps using Docker containers with Azure Container Instances (ACI).

images.title: Run Docker containers with Azure Container Instances

value.title: AZ-104: Configure and manage virtual networks for Azure administrators
value.excerpt: Learn how to configure and manage Azure network capabilities like connectivity services, application protection, application delivery, and network monitoring services. This learning path helps prepare you for Exam AZ-104: Microsoft Azure Administrator.

topItems.title: Configure the network for your virtual machines
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to configure networking in a secure way for your Azure virtual machines.

images.title: Configure the network for your virtual machines

topItems.title: Design an IP addressing schema for your Azure deployment
topItems.excerpt: A good Azure IP addressing schema provides flexibility, room for growth, and integration with on-premises networks. The schema ensures that communication works for deployed resources, minimizes public exposure of systems, and gives the organization flexibility in its network. If not properly designed, systems might not be able to communicate, and additional work will be required to remediate.

images.title: Design an IP addressing schema for your Azure deployment

topItems.title: Host your domain on Azure DNS
topItems.excerpt: Create a DNS zone for your domain name. Create DNS records to map the URL to an IP address. Test that the domain name resolves to your web server.

images.title: Host your domain on Azure DNS

topItems.title: Distribute your services across Azure virtual networks and integrate them by using virtual network peering
topItems.excerpt: Use virtual network peering to enable communication across virtual networks in a way that's secure and minimally complex.

images.title: Distribute your services across Azure virtual networks and integrate them by using virtual network peering
Configure the network for your virtual machines

value.title: AZ-400: Develop an instrumentation strategy
value.excerpt:
Learn how logging, telemetry, and monitoring give you full visibility into what's happening in your environment.
Take this learning path to help prepare for Exam AZ-400: Designing and Implementing Microsoft DevOps Solutions.

topItems.title: Capture Web Application Logs with App Service Diagnostics Logging
topItems.excerpt: Use application logs in Azure Web Apps to help debug web app code.

images.title: Capture Web Application Logs with App Service Diagnostics Logging

topItems.excerpt: Use Azure Resource Manager to organize resources, enforce standards, and protect critical assets from deletion.

images.title: Control and organize Azure resources with Azure Resource Manager

topItems.title: Introduction to App Center
topItems.excerpt: Characterize the types of services offered by App Center. Describe the use of App Center to build, distribute, test, and analyze usage of apps.

images.title: Introduction to App Center

topItems.excerpt: In this workshop, you'll go through tasks to deploy Spring Boot microservices to Azure Spring Cloud (ASC).

images.title: Azure Spring Cloud workshop
Capture Web Application Logs with App Service Diagnostics Logging

value.title: Azure Data Fundamentals: Explore core data concepts
value.excerpt:
Learn the fundamentals of database concepts in a cloud environment, get basic skilling in cloud data services, and build your foundational knowledge of cloud data services within Microsoft Azure.
You will identify and describe core data concepts such as relational, non-relational, big data, and analytics, and explore how this technology is implemented with Microsoft Azure. You will explore the roles, tasks, and responsibilities in the world of data.

topItems.title: Explore core data concepts
topItems.excerpt: Discover how you can organize and process data, explore relational and non-relational databases, and discover how you can process data in batches or using streams.

images.title: Explore core data concepts

topItems.title: Explore roles and responsibilities in the world of data
topItems.excerpt: In this module, you'll learn about the different jobs roles associated with creating, managing, and using databases. You learn about the key responsibilities of these roles, and the tools that these roles use.

images.title: Explore roles and responsibilities in the world of data

topItems.title: Describe concepts of relational data
topItems.excerpt: Explore the relational model for databases, how tables are structured, how you can use indexes to improve query performance, and how you can use views to simplify complex queries.

images.title: Describe concepts of relational data

topItems.title: Explore concepts of non-relational data
topItems.excerpt: Learn about non-relational databases, and how they compare to relational databases. Understand the different types of non-relational databases commonly used by applications.

images.title: Explore concepts of non-relational data
Explore core data concepts

If not properly designed, systems might not be able to communicate, and additional work will be required to remediate.

value.title: Connect your services together learning path
value.excerpt: Use Azure to create website front-ends, back-end services, and triggered functions that compute-on-demand and can also communicate with each other.

topItems.title: Choose a messaging model in Azure to loosely connect your services
topItems.excerpt: When you have an application that consists of components running on different computers, servers, and mobile devices, reliable communications between those components can be difficult and unreliable. Azure provides several technologies that you can use to communicate more reliably, including Storage queues, Event Hubs, Event Grid, and Service Bus. This module shows you how to choose the best technology for your communication task.

images.title: Choose a messaging model in Azure to loosely connect your services

topItems.title: Implement message-based communication workflows with Azure Service Bus
topItems.excerpt: Write C# code in a custom application that sends and receives messages using Azure Service Bus topics and queues.

images.title: Implement message-based communication workflows with Azure Service Bus

topItems.title: Communicate between applications with Azure Queue storage
topItems.excerpt: Implement the publish-subscribe pattern in the cloud using Azure Queue storage.

images.title: Communicate between applications with Azure Queue storage

topItems.title: Enable reliable messaging for Big Data applications using Azure Event Hubs
topItems.excerpt: Connect sending and receiving applications with Event Hubs so you can handle extremely high loads without losing data.

images.title: Enable reliable messaging for Big Data applications using Azure Event Hubs
Choose a messaging model in Azure to loosely connect your services

value.title: Connect your services together
value.excerpt: Azure lets you create applications composed of various components: web site front-ends, back-end services, and triggered functions that perform compute-on-demand services. Azure also includes various communication strategies to let these various components pass data to each other. Learn how to leverage these communication services to create scalable, efficient solutions out of testable components.

topItems.title: Choose a messaging model in Azure to loosely connect your services
topItems.excerpt: When you have an application that consists of components running on different computers, servers, and mobile devices, reliable communications between those components can be difficult and unreliable. Azure provides several technologies that you can use to communicate more reliably, including Storage queues, Event Hubs, Event Grid, and Service Bus. This module shows you how to choose the best technology for your communication task.

images.title: Choose a messaging model in Azure to loosely connect your services

topItems.excerpt: Write C# code in a custom application that sends and receives messages using Azure Service Bus topics and queues.

images.title: Implement message-based communication workflows with Azure Service Bus

topItems.title: Communicate between applications with Azure Queue storage
topItems.excerpt: Implement the publish-subscribe pattern in the cloud using Azure Queue storage.

images.title: Communicate between applications with Azure Queue storage

topItems.title: Enable reliable messaging for Big Data applications using Azure Event Hubs
topItems.excerpt: Connect sending and receiving applications with Event Hubs so you can handle extremely high loads without losing data.

images.title: Enable reliable messaging for Big Data applications using Azure Event Hubs
Choose a messaging model in Azure to loosely connect your services

value.title: Create no-code predictive models with Azure Machine Learning
value.excerpt: Machine learning is at the core of artificial intelligence, and many modern applications and services depend on predictive machine learning models. Learn how to use Azure Machine Learning to create and publish models without writing code.

topItems.title: Use automated machine learning in Azure Machine Learning
topItems.excerpt: Training a machine learning model is an iterative process that requires time and compute resources. Automated machine learning can help make it easier.

topItems.title: Create a Regression Model with Azure Machine Learning designer
topItems.excerpt: Regression is a supervised machine learning technique used to predict numeric values. Learn how to create regression models using Azure Machine Learning designer.

topItems.title: Create a classification model with Azure Machine Learning designer
topItems.excerpt: Classification is a supervised machine learning technique used to predict categories or classes. Learn how to create classification models using Azure Machine Learning designer.

topItems.title: Create a Clustering Model with Azure Machine Learning designer
topItems.excerpt: Clustering is an unsupervised machine learning technique used to group similar entities based on their features. Learn how to create clustering models using Azure Machine Learning designer.

value.title: Implement network security in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to configure, protect, and isolate your networks in Azure.

topItems.title: Security, responsibility, and trust in Azure
topItems.excerpt: Discuss the basic concepts for protecting your infrastructure and data when you work in the cloud. Understand what responsibilities are yours and what Azure takes care of for you.

images.title: Security, responsibility, and trust in Azure

topItems.title: Configure the network for your virtual machines
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to configure networking in a secure way for your Azure virtual machines.

images.title: Configure the network for your virtual machines

topItems.title: Secure and isolate access to Azure resources by using network security groups and service endpoints
topItems.excerpt: Network security groups and service endpoints help you secure your virtual machines and Azure services from unauthorized network access.

images.title: Secure and isolate access to Azure resources by using network security groups and service endpoints

topItems.title: Encrypt network traffic end to end with Azure Application Gateway
topItems.excerpt: Secure the traffic from your users all the way to your web servers by enabling TLS encryption on Application Gateway.

images.title: Encrypt network traffic end to end with Azure Application Gateway
Security, responsibility, and trust in Azure

value.excerpt: Learn about the basics of Docker containers, container orchestration with Kubernetes, and managed clusters on Azure Kubernetes Service.

topItems.title: Introduction to Docker containers
topItems.excerpt: Describes the benefits of using Docker containers as a containerization platform. Discuss the infrastructure provided by the Docker platform.

images.title: Introduction to Docker containers

topItems.title: Introduction to Kubernetes
topItems.excerpt: Determine the types of business problems that can be solved using Kubernetes. Describe the benefits of container orchestration with features like deployment management, automatic updates, and self-healing.

images.title: Introduction to Kubernetes

topItems.title: Introduction to Azure Kubernetes Service
topItems.excerpt: Determine the types of business problems that can be solved using Azure Kubernetes Service. Describe the benefits of container orchestration with features like deployment management, automatic updates, and self-healing.

topItems.title: Deploy a containerized application on Azure Kubernetes Service
topItems.excerpt: Explore how to create and deploy a containerized application using Azure Kubernetes Service using declarative manifest files.

images.title: Introduction to Docker containers

value.title: Create a Windows virtual machine in Azure
value.excerpt: Azure virtual machines (VMs) enable you to create dedicated compute resources in minutes that can be used just like a physical desktop or server machine.

images.title: Create a Windows virtual machine in Azure

value.title: AZ-400: Develop a Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) strategy
value.excerpt:
Learn how Site Reliability Engineering enables you to sustainably achieve the appropriate level of reliability in your systems, services, and products.
Take this learning path to help prepare for Exam AZ-400: Designing and Implementing Microsoft DevOps Solutions.

topItems.title: Introduction to Site Reliability Engineering (SRE)
topItems.excerpt: Organizations big and small have started to realize just how crucial system and application reliability is to their business. They’ve also learned just how difficult it is to maintain that reliability while iterating at the speed demanded by the marketplace. Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) is a proven approach to this challenge.

images.title: Introduction to Site Reliability Engineering (SRE)

topItems.title: Improve incident response with alerting on Azure
topItems.excerpt: Respond to incidents and activities in your infrastructure through alerting capabilities in Azure Monitor.

images.title: Improve incident response with alerting on Azure

topItems.excerpt: Use application logs in Azure Web Apps to help debug web app code.

images.title: Capture Web Application Logs with App Service Diagnostics Logging

topItems.title: Manage site reliability
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to manage site reliability.

images.title: Manage site reliability

value.title: Architect secure infrastructure in Azure learning path
value.excerpt: Learn about the tools and services available on Azure to ensure your resources are secure.

topItems.title: Resolve security threats with Azure Security Center
topItems.excerpt: In this module, you’ll use the alert capabilities of Azure Security Center to watch for and respond to threats.

images.title: Resolve security threats with Azure Security Center

topItems.title: Secure your Azure virtual machine disks
topItems.excerpt: Use Azure Disk Encryption (ADE) to encrypt OS and data disks on existing and new VMs.

images.title: Secure your Azure virtual machine disks

topItems.title: Manage secrets in your server apps with Azure Key Vault
topItems.excerpt: Your application requires service passwords, connection strings, and other secret configuration values to do its job. Storing and handling secret values is risky, and every usage introduces the possibility of leakage. Azure Key Vault, in combination with managed identities for Azure resources, enables your Azure web app to access secret configuration values easily and securely without needing to store any secrets in your source control or configuration.

images.title: Manage secrets in your server apps with Azure Key Vault

topItems.title: Secure your Azure resources with role-based access control (RBAC)
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use RBAC to manage access to resources in Azure.

images.title: Secure your Azure resources with role-based access control (RBAC)
Resolve security threats with Azure Security Center
